story:
Dear Family and Friends,

In May of this year, my mom was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer.  The doctors caught the cancer late and she spent the next 2 months undergoing chemo and radiation, five days per week. 

But let’s rewind her story just a bit… prior to being diagnosed with pancreatic cancer months ago, what some of you may not know is that my mom was a 2x cancer survivor. 

Her first bout with cancer was in 1970, when she was diagnosed with Ovarian Cancer.  She won her battle with Ovarian Cancer but lost her ability to have children.

Shortly thereafter my parents adopted me – another tidbit most people do not know – and she lived every day with a single goal: to be the best mother, ever.  And she succeeded; never faltering. 

Jump to 2004 and she was diagnosed with Thyroid Cancer.  Again, as if someone was watching over her from above, she beat the disease again. 

Now back to her recent battle with cancer… just before Labor Day weekend, she was retested and informed the cancer spread to her liver, bones and lungs.  The Doctors gave her 1-3 months to live!

Despite the news she vowed to fight because she wanted to attend my wedding.  (I got engaged in June, and it was her dream to see my wedding, and the grandchildren that will hopefully follow.)

Unfortunately, no matter how strong her resolve was to attend my wedding, on 10/1/12 her body had other plans.  She was admitted to Lower Cape Fear Hospice Hospital for care.  Her vitals were strong and they said she had weeks left to live. 

Despite the news that she had weeks left to live, on Wednesday morning something guided me to get on a plane and go to her side.  And I did.  Just in time. 

After a 13 hour travel day, I arrived at the Hospice facility.  I was able to thank her for everything she taught me, gave me and instilled in me.  As much as I wanted her to make it to my wedding, I told her it was okay to let go; that she was the best mother ever; and now that I have a career I’m proud of and a fiancé that I love, God is telling her that her job on this earth as a mom is complete and it is time for her to rest peacefully.  That it is time for her to go be with loved ones past; that dad and I will be fine.  We’ll always love her and her memory will live on.   

Within hours of having that conversation with my mom, she peacefully passed away.  It was the hardest, but most rewarding and selfless conversation of my life.  But it could not have been scripted any better. 

This was the toughest 5 months of my life, but I am very thankful to my Microsoft and NBCNews work family as they allotted me the good fortune to work from home on a week-by-week basis so I could spend precious moments with my mom and dad.  My mom would light up like a kid at Christmas every time I walked thru the front door.  She was truly an inspiring woman and her memory shall never fade.  

I had initially thought of asking for donations to be made in her name to the Cancer Society, but after learning that the Hospice Hospital is funded by donations, I would like to make a donation to the Hospice Hospital in her name.

The Hospice facility is amazing.  It rivals a 4 star resort.  Nurses and doctors on-premise 24 hours a day.  The care and compassion the staff showed my mom during her four days at the facility was touching and I want to make sure that for years to come other families have the fortune of being able to lean on the facility during their time of need.

With each $1000.00 donation that is made to the hospital, an inscribed glass tile is added to the facilities “wall of tributes”.  I’d love nothing more than to raise enough to add 3 tiles to the wall, in memory of: Helen Elizabeth Kapral, Jack, John and Kelly Kapral, and “Family and Friends of the Kapral’s”. 

If you have any questions about the donation, the Hospice facility or would like to share stories of other cancer patients, please feel free to reach out to me.

Sincerely,

John

story:
My Story

Although I fully advocate for care within ones own home, I recognize that there does come a time for many when difficult decisions have to be made, like placing a loved one in a long term care facility. This I can tell you, is amongst the hardest.

Mum has Alzheimer's, so it seemed befitting to volunteer at the Alzheimer's Society, I have attended many of their confrences, work shops etc. so as to gain an understanding of the illness, and the challenges we would face caring for mum at home.
Taking the advice of Mum's care team, my sisters and Iexplored all our options, and as we visited day programs, nursing homes and long term care facilities etc. with Mum, I realized,There is an urgent need for, specialized care residences', designed to address the unique needs of people with Alzheimer's.   

 
I run an Eldercare Company, I'm a Champion for Demintia, volunteer at the Alzheimer's Society, undergone specialized (AD)training, and have over 2 decades experience running my own Nursery School business in the UK, this has equipped, and given me insight as to the appropriate care & stimulus required, for persons afflicted with AD .   


Alzheimers disease (and related Dementia) causes physical changes to the brain that affects all areas of functioning and behavior, it is crucial for facilities providing careto adapt their program to meet these unique needs, by developing a very different approach to the traditional care and activities.
 

An Alternative To Traditional Long Term Care Institutions


A boutique residence , with a design concept & program, especially for people diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease(AD) or a related dementia. No more that 6 residents... because there are no obvious visible signs of the disease, relating to those invisible losses are one of the most difficult aspects of caring for someone with AD.
 
The Most Important Aspect of our care is, it is completely free of restraints, neither chemical nor physical restraints will ever be used & flexibility so that the residents can:

~ Eat when they are hungry.      

~ Sleep when they are tired.
~ Wander around and go outside when they want. 
~ Residents feel like they have some independence and control.
~ Plan care around each resident  

 
Did You Know ?
According to the Canadian Institute for Health Information, in 2006-2007, 37.7% of residents residing in long-term care homes on public drug programs were prescribed antipsychotic versus only 2.6% of older adults living in the community? During this same time period, 52.2% of residents with claims for anti-dementia drugs also had claims for atypical antipsychotic, compared to 21.3% of older adults living in the community.
Many long-term care homes routinely fail to obtain consent to treatment at all. Other homes attempt to obtain “blanket” consents at the time of admission which purportedly apply to all treatments that might be prescribed during the course of their stay. This is not legal as it in no way meets the requirements of “informed” consent as defined by the Health Care Consent Act.
Many long-term care homes routinely fail to obtain consent to treatment at all. Other homes attempt to obtain “blanket” consents at the time of admission which purportedly apply to all treatments that might be prescribed during the course of their stay. This is not legal as it in no way meets the requirements of “informed” consent as defined by the Health Care Consent Act.

What You Can Do To Help
Attend the all parties meeting in your area for the upcoming Provincial Elections and ask your MP if elected, will he/she address This “Raising Tide” that is Alzheimer’s, within their first 90 days in office.
If you agree that our loved ones with AD or Dementia need specialist care now! And deserve to have a quality life that is free from restraints’ then please DONATE as best you can.
If you are unable to donate at this time;  Please help us to achieve our campaign goal by spreading the word to as many people as possible… Word of mouth, email, twitter, face book, by what ever means necessary!    
Pray and have faith, that the cause and a cure will soon be found for this dreadful illness, that’s robbing so many of their very self.

story:
Gurnal was diagnosed with Erdheim Chester disease in September 2012, only 75 people in the WORLD have it.    Erdheim Chester disease acts like a progressive cancer and is treated in the same way.    Gurnal has been very sick, unable to work and his wife Julie (my sister) is caring for him while he is in and out of the hospital.    She cannot work while she cares for him and their children Aidan(9) and Lexi (7).        

We are asking for donations of any amount to help cover the expenses mounting for the family.   Please consider this cause!!!!

story:
About Kadeisha & her Diagnosis

Kadeisha is a 37-year-old mom of two adorable toddlers (Elijah and Yasmin) and fiancée to Nery Madrid. In December of 2011 Kadeisha discovered a lump in her right breast and after 4 months of seeking answers was diagnosed with aggressive stage 3 cancer.
 
Kadeisha chose to utilize alternative methods of treatment by seeing a Naturopathic doctor, using juicing, colon therapy, hydrotherapy and high dose Vitamin C to treat cancer sells in a more natural and supportive way to the body. 
 
By the time she had surgery in May, her tumor had shrunk over a centimeter.  She has made the bold and courageous decision to forego recommended chemotherapy and radiation and stay firm in her conviction that using alternative methods of healing is a more positive and safer way to treat her whole body. Kadeisha's doctors at Three Rivers Natural Medicine in Fort Collins, Colorado are treating her with high dose vitamin C IV, oxidative treatments, ST8 machine and hyberbaric chamber all to introduce high doses of oxygen into the body to kill cancer cells.

To deal with the excess estrogen that feeds her cancer response, Kadeisha has chosen also to go natural.  Instead of using Tamoxifen, which is given to block estrogen receptors, she used Indole-3-Carbinol a compound found in cruciferous vegetables such as cabbage, broccoli, kale and cauliflower. It has powerful antioxidant properties and the ability to increase the body’s anti-toxin enzyme activity. Indole-3-carbinol has the ability to break down cancer causing estrogen and dioxin (a pesticide) rendering them harmless.  She is now using DIM, similar to Indole-3-Carbinol, but has been easier on her system.

Kadeisha has responded very well to these treatments and her last Thermograph body scan showed that currently there are no signs of cancer growing.  The focus is now on getting her inflamed lymphatic system healthy in her breast and throughout the rest of her body.
 

What We Need

Your extra helpful support! In order for Kadeisha to continue her treatments for the next six-months to a year, our goal is to raise at least 5,000 dollars.  This would help pay for her naturopathic doctor visits, high dose vitamin C IV’s, natural medicines and continued juicing regimen.  It also helps Nery (her fiancée) and her family, take time from work to support her and their two kids during this process.  Although we know the cost will far exceed $5000, we hope that her story of beating this cancer with alternative medicine will help us surpass our goal significantly.

As Kadeisha heals herself from breast cancer, our intention is to help the family be free of worry and financial burdens. We want our family’s focus to be on helping her back to health and wellness!

Many of you know this family and many of you may not, but know that no matter how you can help- your contribution will help ease the burden of this wonderful family.

The Impact

Supporting and sharing this campaign will not only support Kadeisha and her family but will also raise awareness about innovative, safe and effective therapies to facilitate healing and prevent disease.  Therapies like homeopathy, acupuncture, herbal medicine and nutrition encourage full and complete healing of mind and body.

It is our hope to promote a path of empowerment for all families to become healthy and vital and to prevent illnesses like cancer, heart disease, etc and improve the quality of all of our lives.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please keep Kadeisha in your thoughts and prayers.  Your positive energy and words of encouragement are always welcomed.  We truly appreciate all of your kindness and support during this difficult time. 

Please share this page with everyone you know, such as posting this link on your Facebook page.  Together we can come together to show the greatness of alternative medicine, and show support to Kadeisha on her journey to getting well!

Sincere Love and Gratitude to you ALL!!!

story:
I need your help :( I have been diagnosed with Osteomyelitis a Streptococcus Bone Marrow Infection. I will need treatment for the next 2 to 3 months I pride myself as a person who is extremely outgoing, and positive. I used to do a lot with my daughter and now I cannot. About 8 months ago I started having 100’F to 101’F fever everyday as well as fatigue. After 3 months of this, pain was added to my list of symptoms & I found a cavity in my back molar so I went to the dentist. He performed an emergency root canal and gum surgery.  After the root canal my symptoms surprisingly got WORSE, Pain, fatigue and eventually sepsis in my body. Despite trying 6 simple antibiotics my infection continued to worsen. We discovered the molar was fractured during the root canal, allowing the infection had spread to my jaw bone. After a CT-Scan and almost 30 vials of blood I finally had a diagnosis.. I have DENTAL OSTEOMYELITIS, which is a Bone Infection and if not treated can kill me. My white count is too low to travel and I have already spent a little over $5500 on the wrong treatment.  Now I NEED to Correct treatment. I am desperate to live, be healthy again and be there and do things with my daughter! She's a teenager and really needs her mother in her life!

This is why I am asking for help, any help please.  I haven’t been able to work in over 7 months and my daughter is starting high school in a little over a month from now.  She needs her mom healthy and strong. I DON'T have Dental Insurance and only Basic medical insurance which won't cover this treatment.   The only medication left to treat this for me is IV-Vancomycin.

Medication only: Vancomycin IV $15,000

Outpatient IV treatment: cost $13,552 per patient

Dental jaw surgery: $7000++

CT-Scan $785.00

Doctors appts and Previous treatments: $5500

Estimated Cost for my recovery: $41,837.00++

It doesn't matter if its $10, $25 or $100 every little bit helps. And if you cannot afford to donate, please will you email it or post this on various social networking tools to spread the word for me?

My recovery will be long and costly much more than I am asking.  The goal is only set at $10,000, but I'm hoping  for more donations to cover all my medical bills from Osteomyelitis....but anything will help!! Thank you for reading..I appreciate anything you can do! xo
story_txt:
I need your help :( I have been diagnosed with Osteomyelitis a Streptococcus Bone Marrow Infection. I will need treatment for the next 2 to 3 months I pride myself as a person who is extremely outgoing, and positive. I used to do a lot with my daughter and now I cannot. About 8 months ago I started having 100’F to 101’F fever everyday as well as fatigue. After 3 months of this, pain was added to my list of symptoms & I found a cavity in my back molar so I went to the dentist. He performed an emergency root canal and gum surgery.  After the root canal my symptoms surprisingly got WORSE, Pain, fatigue and eventually sepsis in my body. Despite trying 6 simple antibiotics my infection continued to worsen. We discovered the molar was fractured during the root canal, allowing the infection had spread to my jaw bone. After a CT-Scan and almost 30 vials of blood I finally had a diagnosis.. I have DENTAL OSTEOMYELITIS, which is a Bone Infection and if not treated can kill me. My white count is too low to travel and I have already spent a little over $5500 on the wrong treatment.  Now I NEED to Correct treatment. I am desperate to live, be healthy again and be there and do things with my daughter! She's a teenager and really needs her mother in her life!
This is why I am asking for help, any help please.  I haven’t been able to work in over 7 months and my daughter is starting high school in a little over a month from now.  She needs her mom healthy and strong. I DON'T have Dental Insurance and only Basic medical insurance which won't cover this treatment.   The only medication left to treat this for me is IV-Vancomycin.
Medication only: Vancomycin IV $15,000
Outpatient IV treatment: cost $13,552 per patient
Dental jaw surgery: $7000++
CT-Scan $785.00
Doctors appts and Previous treatments: $5500
Estimated Cost for my recovery: $41,837.00++
It doesn't matter if its $10, $25 or $100 every little bit helps. And if you cannot afford to donate, please will you email it or post this on various social networking tools to spread the word for me?
My recovery will be long and costly much more than I am asking.  The goal is only set at $10,000, but I'm hoping  for more donations to cover all my medical bills from Osteomyelitis....but anything will help!! Thank you for reading..I appreciate anything you can do! xo

story:
This is a public crowd funding project. The product is NOT on the market yet. With your support we can finish the product. This is how it works:

  1. We need your support to finish the App and the Distance Coach System.
  2. See the movie and/or read the text (at least the first part) to find out why you should support us.
  3. Buy a "perk" for a campaign discount, on the right side of the page. You will of course get something in return.
  4. Or, share the project with your friends. Be sure to come back and check in on our progress. 

 

What is MinBalans?

Up to 95 % of people that try to get in shape or be healthier, without proffesional assistance, fails. The ones that invest in a personal coach get the real results. Everyone should be able to get a personal coach to finally get in shape,. MinBalans is an application for smartphones that is easy and effective, and puts you in contact with a living coach that supports you and makes you succeed.

 

Who is it for?

The system is for You who want to get in shape and look and feel your best. It will help you find your weight, be active, stress less and sleep more. From the proffesional athlete to the overworked inactive parent. All in one tool.

It's for the Coach (trainer, psychologist, physical therapist, nutritionist) that is lacking a system to work close with their client/patient, and keep them on track between your sessions, or want the opportunity to work and make profit as a distance coach.

It's for the Company that wants to help their employees become and stay healthy, and proactively keep track on their well-being and minimize sick leave.

 

What's so special with the App?

We are creating a different App, MinBalans. The name is Swedish and it simply means "My Balance". Having the App is like having your own coach in your pocket and it will help you make the changes you can’t make on your own. 

It is also a very powerful tool for existing coaches to take your clients/patients to new levels.

 

Why is it different than other health tools on the market?

You are no longer on your own. Your Personal Coach will guide you 

MinBalans is the first health tool on the market that offers the user access to a personal distance coach through the app. A living person, a professional, who can follow your steps and guide you. This opens up a world of opportunities to help you succeed. We believe having a distance coach is one of the most cost-effective solutions to create the lasting health changes we lack today. Learn more about the coach system below. 

It's complete

MinBalans is different than other health tools and apps on the market. We want to see to the whole of you - food, activity, sleep and stress. Just focusing on your diet won’t help you become healthy if you are stressed all the time.

It teaches you how to balance

We don’t believe that you have to live as a robot to achieve good health. That's why most people fail in creating change. It's about knowing how to balance negative impacts with positive behaviors. Live life and feel good about it. Let the app teach you how.

The design is unique. Steve Jobs had it right - Keep it simple

The first step is becoming aware of your habits. This is done by logging information on how you live and behave in the app. To make people really want to do this, MinBalans has a new type of design and user interface that makes logging easy, effective and fun. Several global studies show that logging lifestyle is one of the strongest factors to help create change. It simply works. 

Log information quickly by swiping instead of writing.



 

Direct feedback on your progress through the coach and easy-to-follow statistics.

 

How the Personal Coach works

Tired of not making your goals, as the other 95 % that can't reach them on their own? Then it's time for you do get your personal coach:

-Sign up on a special price Indiegogo deal by buying a coach package, out on the right side of the page, for yourself or a friend.

-When the coach system is finished, you download the app on Appstore (later for Android) and we connect you with our professional coaches.

-Together with the coach we set a plan after your goals.

-You log your progress in the app. The Coach will follow, assist and guide you towards your goal, no matter where you are. This will motivate you like never before, it's proven.

 

If you are working as a trainer, psychologist, physical therapist, nutritionist etcetera, the MinBalans Coach Platform is the tool you've been missing. Take your clients to new levels and profit from it.

The Coach platform allows coaches to assist their clients from their computer or mobile device. In our Perk Section to the right, you can support us and be the first to get access to the web client.

 

 

 

How the Coach Platform works for Coaches

-You pre order the coach system on the right side of the page. When the system is complete you receive your login and you can access the system on any webreader 

-Your clients, either today existing or new clients for distance coaching, download the MinBalans App for free on Appstore (later for Android)

-You charge your clients for the service, unless you want to work with a different deal. The Fee and the amount of time you devote to the client on a distance is up to you to set.

-You connet the client's app to your Coach system. Everything they log will be seen and you can coach them, remind them and give feedback in between sessions or at a distance. 

 

The team behind MinBalans consists of a crew of experts with a desire to create a change in people’s health and balance. We have the experience and expertise to back it up, working within the areas of Physical Therapy, Psychology, Nutrition, Personal Training and Behavioral Therapy. Every day, we dedicate all we have to make people feel better and to help them reach balance, both mentally and physically. We come from different fields of practice and share one thing in common: We strongly believe that there is a more effective way for long lasting change in people’s health and habits.

What inspires us is the possibility to reach out with our tool globally in order to really make a difference in both the private and public health sector.

 

Today, patients are usually on their own, even though it's proven that closer contact with therapists increase compliance. However, this can be very expensive. With the MinBalans app and the Coach system, public health care officials can proactively work to prevent diseases and improve long-term health. This will be a much cheaper and more effective way to assist patients in actually reaching their goals. 

Our funding goal is $45,000. How will we use the funds?

$18,000 - First we'll update our beta version of the iPhone app, which has been tested by users for a couple of months with great response. We also need to finish the integration with the distance coach, so that information can be sent back and forth between the app and the coaches’ web tool. The app will be free for everyone to use for logging and statistic feedback. 

$27,000 - Secondly, we'll invest in the development of the distance coach. This will get the tool running for coaches who really want to make a difference in their clients' lives, and to help society become healthier.

If we receive more funds than our goal, we will continue making the system available on more Smartphone platforms, such as the Android. We will also develop the system to be used by public health care providers.

 

Spread the word
Even if you can't contribute financially, you can help us improve global health by sharing this campaign via Facebook, Twitter, etc. Indiegogo has some great share tools to make it easy and we really need word of mouth to make this happen. 

Companies: Gold Sponsorship
If you're a health-conscious company, please take this opportunity to shine as a sponsor on our web site. It's a great way to find new followers for your company. Our team will also provide you with 10 hours of consulting on how to lift the health of your employs, by using the app.

 

* The person that will be the user of any of the Coach systems” will be connected to one or more of our own coaches. Through the application we will set your goals and work together towards getting you in better balance. This includes weekly feedback on your loggings and helpful alternative solutions. Messages between the client and coach will be directed via the app. The client gets to ask questions straight to the coach and also send pictures of food and activity. 

* In Swedish "MinBalans" simply means "My Balance". People need to learn how to balance their lives and get the support they need.

story:
WOW, She's come a long way.  Keep up the hard work Ruthie.  It's paying off and you'll be home SOON Baby !!!!!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Ruthie walked the Avon Breast Cance Walk in NYC 10/2010 (with dyed pink hair and all), 2 months prior to her tragic accident. Ruthie will be WALKING it again October 20-21, 2012.  GO RUTHIE !!!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Calling all Friend's of Ruth. We need your help again. 

Please help us get Ruthie HOME!!!

 

The two-year mark of that horrific day that ROCKED the Hebden's world is quickly approaching. We are in the process and planning phase of reaching the ultimate goal of this journey... GETTING RUTHIE "HOME" FOR GOOD. As most of you recall, Ruthie was in a near fatal automobile accident on December 22, 2010. She sustained a traumatic brain injury, had 3 strokes and has recovered from many other complications resulting from the accident. She has worked so very hard over the past 18 months to regain her life back. She has had to relearn EVERYTHING (eat, walk, talk, etc.). Her survival and recovery has been nothing short of a true miracle. Thanks be to GOD.

 

We want to take this opportunity to thank all of our "Friend's of Ruth" for your continued prayers, love and support. Without all of you Ruthie would not be where she is today in her recovery. The funds raised during the "Friends of Ruth" benefit in June 2011 enabled Ruthie to attend a 10-week long Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) camp in Canada this past spring. Ruthie made such tremendous progress, and experienced so much healing at Ability Camp that we knew at the conclusion of the spring session that another would be needed in the future. We documented her entire successful journey on a blog web site to share with all of you, www.friendsofruth.com. Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy is very expensive and unfortunately is NOT COVERED BY INSURANCE.

 

We are in the process of having Ruthie evaluated for a piece of equipment called the WalkAide. Ruthie's main obstacle in walking on her own now is due to a problem called Foot Drop. The stroke and/or brain injury caused a neurological disconnect from the brain to the nerve that tells you to lift your foot while walking. This device sends an electrical stimulation to that nerve and lifts her Foot Drop. The WalkAide is a very expensive piece of equipment and unfortunately is NOT COVERED BY INSURANCE.

 

Ruthie has a very ambitious goal of something very dear to her heart that she wants to participate in this fall. The Avon Breast Cancer Walk in NYC. Two months prior to Ruthie's tragic accident she trained, raised entry funds and completed the 39-mile Avon Breast Cancer Walk in NYC (with dyed PINK HAIR and all). One day a few months ago Ruthie saw the TV ad for this years Avon Walk. She became very animated and excited when she saw the commercial. She obviously REMEMBERED the hard work training, the grueling raising of donation funds, the excitement of the walk and the total self-satisfaction she felt at the finish line. Ruthie wants to participate in the Avon Breast Cancer Walk - NYC - October 20-21, 2012. Ruthie will have to raise $1,800.00 again in donations in order to walk.

 

Ruthie is well on her way of getting HOME. We hope and pray to get her home by the end of this year. Back in Oct 2011 Ruthie's health insurance discontinued coverage and payments to the rehab facility that she is presently at, and there is sure to be many more non-covered and unexpected expenses.

 

PLEASE help the HEBDEN's in way you can:

 

Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy & Conductive Education (5 week camp) - $10,000.00

 

WalkAide (nerve stimulating device) - $5,000.00

 

Avon Breast Cancer Walk 2012 (donations to be raised, reg. and accommodation fees) - $ 2,800.00

 

Ruthie HOME for good - PRICELESS

 

 

PERSONAL CHECKS or MONEY ORDERS can be addressed to the order of: “Friends of Ruth”

 

Friends of Ruth

C/O Carol Panzarino

97 Old Branch Rd

Wingdale, NY 12594

 

 

CREDIT CARD donations can be made at: www.indiegogo.com/friendsofruth (Until Aug 30, 2012)

 

 

 

Thank you again for all of your help in the past and thank you in advance for any help you are able to provide in the future.

GOD BLESS

 
 

PS: The continued LOVE & SUPPORT from "Friends of Ruth" is so very

important at this stage of her recovery. Ruthie LOVES to

receive visitors and mail. Her address is:

Northeast Center for Special Care

Ruth Hebden - NRP-5, Room 425

300 Grant Ave

Lake Katrine, NY 12449.

<iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FRobe_B-BNo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Donations can be made to: Friends of Ruth GOD BLESS PS: The continued LOVE & SUPPORT from "Friends of Ruth" is so very important at this stage of her recovery. One day a few months ago Ruthie saw the TV ad for this years Avon Walk. She became very animated and excited when she saw the commercial. She obviously REMEMBERED the hard work training, the grueling raising of donation funds, the excitement of the walk and the total self-satisfaction she felt at the finish line. Ruthie wants to participate in the Avon Breast Cancer Walk - NYC - October 20-21, 2012. Ruthie will have to raise $1,800.00 again in donations in order to walk.
 


Ruthie is well on her way of getting HOME. We hope and pray to get her home by the end of this year. Back in Oct 2011 Ruthie's health insurance discontinued coverage and payments to the rehab facility that she is presently at, and there is sure to be many more non-covered and unexpected expenses.
 


PLEASE help the HEBDEN's in way you can:

 

Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy & Conductive Education (5 week camp) - $10,000.00


 


WalkAide (nerve stimulating device) - $5,000.00


 


Avon Breast Cancer Walk 2012 (donations to be raised, reg. and accommodation fees) - $ 2,800.00


 


Ruthie HOME for good - PRICELESS


 


 


PERSONAL CHECKS or MONEY ORDERS can be addressed to the order of: “Friends of Ruth”


 


Friends of Ruth


C/O Carol Panzarino


97 Old Branch Rd


Wingdale, NY 12594


 

 

CREDIT CARD donations can be made at: www.indiegogo.com/friendsofruth (Until Aug 30, 2012)

 
 
 

Thank you again for all of your help in the past and thank you in advance for any help you are able to provide in the future.


GOD BLESS

 
 

PS: The continued LOVE & SUPPORT from "Friends of Ruth" is so very


important at this stage of her recovery. Ruthie LOVES to


receive visitors and mail. Her address is:


Northeast Center for Special Care


Ruth Hebden - NRP-5, Room 425


300 Grant Ave


Lake Katrine, NY 12449.

<iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FRobe_B-BNo" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
 

 

 

 
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
WOW, She's come a long way.  Keep up the hard work Ruthie.  It's paying off and you'll be home SOON Baby !!!!!
 

 

 
 

 
 
 
 
 

 

 
 

 
 
 
Calling all Friend's of Ruth. We need your help again. Please help get Ruthie HOME!!! The two-year mark of that horrific day that ROCKED the Hebden's world is quickly approaching. We are in the process and planning phase of reaching the ultimate goal of this journey... GETTING RUTHIE "HOME" FOR GOOD. As most of you recall, Ruthie was in a near fatal automobile accident on December 22, 2010. She sustained a traumatic brain injury, had 3 strokes and has recovered from many other complications resulting from the accident. She has worked so very hard over the past 18 months to regain her life back. She has had to relearn EVERYTHING (eat, walk, talk, etc.). Her survival and recovery has been nothing short of a true miracle. Thanks be to GOD. We want to take this opportunity to thank all of our "Friend's of Ruth" for your continued prayers, love and support. Without all of you Ruthie would not be were she is today in her recovery. The funds raised during the "Friends of Ruth" benefit in June 2011 enabled Ruthie to attend a 10-week long Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) camp in Canada this past spring. Ruthie made such tremendous progress, and experienced so much healing at Ability Camp (www.abilitycamp.com) that we knew at the conclusion of the spring session that another would be needed in the future. We documented the entire successful journey on a blog web site to share with all of you, www.friendsofruth.com. Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy is very expensive and unfortunately NOT COVERED BY INSURANCE. We are in the process of having Ruthie evaluated for a piece of equipment called the WalkAide. Ruthie's main obstacle in walking on her own now is due to a problem called Foot Drop. The stroke and/or brain injury caused a neurological disconnect from the brain to the nerve that tells you to lift your foot while walking. This device sends an electrical stimulation to that nerve and lifts her Foot Drop. The WalkAide is a very expensive piece of equipment and unfortunately NOT COVERED BY INSURANCE. Ruthie has a very ambitious goal of something very dear to her heart that she wants to participate in this fall. The Avon Breast Cancer Walk in NYC. Two months prior to Ruthie's tragic accident she trained, raised entry funds and completed the 39-mile Avon Breast Cancer walk in NYC (with dyed PINK HAIR and all). One day a few months ago Ruthie saw the TV ad for this years Avon Walk. She became very animated and excited when she saw the commercial. She obviously REMEMBERED the hard work training, the grueling raising of donation funds, the excitement of the walk and the total self-satisfaction she felt at the finish line. Ruthie wants to participate in the Avon Breast Cancer Walk - NYC - October 20-21, 2012. Ruthie will have to raise $1,800.00 again in donations in order to walk. Ruthie is well on her way of getting HOME. We hope and pray to get her home by the end of this year. There is sure to be many more non-covered and unexpected expenses. PLEASE help the HEBDEN's in any way you can: Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (5 week camp) - $10,000.00 WalkAide (nerve stimulating device) - $5,000.00 Avon Breast Cancer Walk 2012 (donations to be raised, registration, and accommodation fees) - $ 2,800.00 Ruthie HOME for goood - PRICELESS Thank you again for all of your help in the past and thank you in advance for any help you are able to provide in the future. Donations can be made to: Friends of Ruth GOD BLESS PS: The continued LOVE & SUPPORT from "Friends of Ruth" is so very important at this stage of her recovery. Ruthie LOVES to receive visitors and mail. Her address is: Northeast Center for Special Care, Ruth Hebden - NRP-5, Room 425, 300 Grant Ave, Lake Katrine, NY 12449.

story:
My name is Audrey and I'm 19. Please help me raise money to better my Dad's Parkinson's. He has been getting worse and worse as the years pass and all the medications don't seem to do the trick. My dad needs some therapy and treatment that we cannot afford. He does not know that I am making this campaign for him, so I would love to surprise him with something this special.

He has been through a lot throughout his life and he deserves to be treat with the best therapy. My brother doesn't help his stress level, which in turn effects his parkinson's. My dad truely is an amazing person and I would really love to help him out. I do not have the funds to do so myself, otherwise I would have done it a long time ago. I do all of my school projects on my Dad and his disease (which he still doesn't know) and I look up to him more than ever. I just moved in with him and am spending quality time with him for once in my life, and I want him to be able to do stuff with me just like we did when I was young.

The money raised will be used for various medical expenses due to his parkinson's as well as new treatments.

Don't forget to use the share tools!!!!!!!

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Rani Hughes. I am an occupational therapist and master trainer in tai chi for health programs. I have been learning and teaching tai chi for over 15 years.  In 2011, I visited Sri Lanka and trained 30 physiotherapists and occupational therapists in Kandy General Hospital in how to conduct safe and effective modified tai chi classes for their patients with chronic health conditions. This training was a great success, the therapist continuing to teach the program to their patients today. All of the costs associated with this workshop was completely covered by me. 


Immediately after this workshop, I had many other hospitals, universities and the National Wushsu Coaches Council of Sri Lanka request me to run similar workshops in their region. Unfortunately I had to return to Melbourne, Australia for work.


I want to return to Sri Lanka in January 2013 to offer an update for the health professionals I trained in 2011, and to offer another tai chi 'train the trainer' workshop. However I need your help to make this happen. I can not afford to fund these workshops alone. 


The Impact

As the standard of living in Sri Lanka improves, so too does number of people with chronic disease such as diabetes, heart disease and cancer. Currently Sri Lankan therapists (eg. physiotherapists and occupational therapists) work 1:1 with their patients. This is very time consuming and expensive way to treat patients. Soon, Sri Lanka's public health system will not be able to cope with these new demands. 


The benefits of tai chi as a self management strategy to improve health in people with chronic conditions is well established within the medical literature (Journal of Nursing and Healthcare of Chronic Illness, 2011). Modified Tai Chi is taught by therapists to small groups of people with chronic illness, decreasing the demands on therapist's time and saving the government much precious health care money. 


Currently, no one in Sri Lanka is able to teach therapists how to conduct safe and effective modified tai chi classes for their patients with chronic illness. Therapist needs to travel abroad to receive this training. As a qualified master trainer in tai chi for health programs, I would like to offer this training in Sri Lanka for health professionals at no cost for the individual or for the hospital they work in. 


What We Need & What You Get

I need $5,237 to offer 2 tai chi training workshops in Sri Lanka. 

Airfare:  Thai $1,727 (Emirates $1,928, Singapore $1,928)

Accommodation:  Approx $60 per night x 10 nights =  $600 (this is mid range accommodation)

Transport: $10 per visit to hospital x 9 visits = $90

Tai Chi products (eg. DVD/handbooks) to update health professionals trained in 2011 x 30 people.

Tai Chi for Arthritis Part 2 DVD $30 each x 30 people = $900

Tai Chi products (eg. DVD/handbooks) to train 30 new health professionals

Tai Chi for Arthritis DVD  $36 each x 30 people = $1,080

Tai Chi for Arthritis handbook $13 each x 30 people = $390

Teaching manual $15 each x 30 people = $450

Total = $5,237


I am happy to donate my time for free. 


If I do not reach my target goal, I will just offer an update workshop for the health professionals I already trained in 2011. I have applied for funding to the Asian Women's Consultative Council, and eagerly await their response. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I encourage fellow tai chi enthusiasts, health professionals, people with chronic illnesses and members of our global community to ask their friends and family to support this project.

story:
Mark is just celebrated his 50th birthday on Sept. 20, 2012.  He was diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes at age 30 (the same age as our mother was when she was diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes).  He has worked hard all his life, always working two and three jobs to support his family.  He never asks for anything for himself and he is always willing to help anyone with anything at anytime.  He is truly a selfless person and I'd like to help him get his new teeth without him having to borrow the entire amount of money he needs before he can schedule this procedure.  His wife, Bobbie, does a great job keeping track of his blood sugars and his overall health.  She recently spent the last year working with their health insurance company to get Mark an insulin pump, which has seemed to help stabalize his blood sugar.  Their daughter, Courtney, is a senior in college and she also works hard to contribute as much money as possible to her college bills.  But she, too, will graduate with a huge debt of her own.   Please consider making a contribution to this great guy who never asks for anything for himself.  But he desperately needs the new teeth to continue to eat normal foods and keep his diabtetic life as normal as possible! 

If you know Mark, you know he is always positive and upbeat and fun to be around.  He does so much for everyone in his life and never asks for anything in return.  If you've ever been in need of help but you didn't know where to turn, you can understand how hard it would be for him to ask anyone for help.  Mark is too proud to ask for help for himself so that's why I created this campaign. 

Thanks so much to everyone who reads this and if you are inspired to donate, thank you and God bless!  And feel free to share this link with your friends and family.  Thanks again!

P.S.  Our dear mother died at the young age of 59 (20 yrs. ago) from kidney failure as a direct result from Type 1 diabetes.  We still miss her so much every day:(

story:
The Goal – Heal my brother and together let’s blow the lid on healing.

This is a call out for help and support to heal my brother from Crohn's disease. When making this decision and thinking about what we could also give back, we decided on setting out to prove you can heal Crohn's disease via natural methods with no prescribed medication.

The total economic burden of Crohn’s disease is up to $15.5 billion in the United States and €16.7 billion in Europe.

1 in 200 Americans struggle with IBD with 1 in 250 suffering in the United Kingdom.

First id like to list the things you can do to help us.

Simple things that dont all require money, simple actions create huge waves.

  • Make a contribution here & claim your perk in exchange
  • If you have any connections in magazines, forums or radio to spread the word that would be awesome.
  • Send out to your newsletters or community networks, work intranets if you feel drawn to. 

The Money

We have calculated that Lloyd needs - $29,467.81 converted in british pounds £18,423.43 in total to support him during one year of his healing journey. This amount includes supplements, diet and therapies. We have also added on the Indiegogo fees of $2,150.

Suffering from IBD is financially devastating both individually and economically with some medical treatments such as Infliximab/Remicade costing in the region of £31,499 to £37,488 a year per patient. This is based on maintenance treatment or a fistulising disease state such as Lloyds.

When you put this into perspective the alternative treatment, while still expensive, is far cheaper and less financially/economically devastating.

Some Statistics on IBD (Crohn's or Colitis).

The total economic burden of Crohn’s disease is up to $15.5 billion in the United States and €16.7 billion in Europe.

1 in 200 Americans struggle with IBD with 1 in 250 suffering in the United Kingdom.

IBD is one of the five most prevalent gastrointestinal disease burdens in the United States. This chronic condition is without a medical cure and commonly requires a lifetime of care. Each year in the United States, IBD accounts for more than 700,000 physician visits, 100,000 hospitalizations, and disability in 119,000 patients. Over the long term, up to 75% of patients with Crohn’s disease and 25% of those with ulcerative colitis will require surgery.

 

If you can think of anyone that may benifit from witnessing this journey please send it on. IBD is becoming much more common in people of all ages, the more we can spread the information the more we create awareness and support.

 

Thank you for taking the time to read this campaign.

One love
Simon

Rescorces:

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18067689

http://www.ccfa.org/

http://www.nacc.org.uk

http://www.crd.york.ac.uk/CRDWeb/ShowRecord.asp?ID=22008101263

story:
Friends of KBBI, we are asking you for help in replacing our two beloved audio consoles. This vital equipment makes it possible for you to hear the programs you cherish on AM 890. A 23% decrease ($30,500) in state funding prevents KBBI from launching this project alone and it cannot be held off any longer.

We wanted to be realistic and achievable with this online campaign goal of $12,000 though the funding gap is $22,000. All donations will support this vital project. We are excited that we are exceeding the goal. Thank YOU!

What are Audio Consoles:
The audio consoles are pieces of equipment KBBI uses to route audio from the studio to broadcast on the airwaves. So when a host is reading your daily Bushlines, playing music, or patching callers into our live Coffee Table show; our hearty sound boards are maintaining volume, audio clarity, and much, much more. This is how we broadcast City Council and Borough Assembly meetings, your favorite local music shows and the voices of our daily Morning Edition and Weekend Hosts.

Basically, the consoles are like a train station. All the trains change tracks and travel in and out through them. Without them we have no way to use our studio microphones, play music or as Ron Burgundy would say, “read the news.” Without them we can’t give you quality local radio.

What's Wrong with KBBI's Current Audio Consoles:
These analog consoles are the heart of KBBI and have been in use 24/7 since 2002. They are old and challenging to operate. The manufacturer doesn't even carry replacement parts anymore. Technology has advanced rapidly over the years and the consoles have exceeded their lifespan. The reality of the situation is that these consoles can no longer be repaired and if they fail we will be off the air.

The Financial Situation:
The total cost of the new consoles and their installation is roughly $52,000 and we are striving to raise at least $12,000 through this crowdsourcing campaign. We are grateful to have secured a $25,000 Rasmuson Foundation grant and a $5,000 grant from the Homer Foundation. Thanks to these grants, we are over half-way there which is a fantastic start!

Although the funding gap is $22,000, we are only asking for $12,000 through this campaign because we want to set an achievable goal. If we exceed this goal the additional money will continue to support this vital project.

Timing is urgent. Alaska Public Broadcasting Inc. can only pay the labor costs associated with this project through the summer. That financial support may not be an option next year due to the heavy impact of state budget cuts. The labor cost is about $6,000, and is not included in the project budget.

The Plan:
We have consulted a trusted engineer with years of experience working in public radio stations throughout Alaska. We've researched two audio consoles that we must purchase, with your help, and install this summer.

Getting this show on the Road…with perks!
We have some unique perks to offer. Like co-pilot a DJ show (Ryjil Christianson pictured below with Glenn Caldwell during Slack Tide). Check them all out on the right side of this page. Click on a perk to go to a payment page. If you wish to keep your support private, select "Hide my name on the campaign page." Want to support at a different level? No worries, just enter the amount on the top right above "contribute now."



Where Your Donation Will Go:
  • All funds raised will support this project 100%.
  • The purchase of two new Wheatstone audio consoles, one for the on-air studio and one for audio production.
  • Shipping costs to Homer.
  • Parts, adapters and modifications inside the studios to meet the needs of the new digital equipment.
  • Travel and hosting costs for an engineer to install the equipment and reroute our electrical matrix (about 10 days).
  • Immense gratitude from KBBI’s staff, volunteers, your fellow listeners and supporters of this project.
  • Best of all you'll help keep KBBI alive and available in our community 24/7.

Together We Can Make This Happen!
Our two analog consoles have served KBBI and listeners well over the last thirteen years, but the time has come for us to upgrade. The more people we can reach, the sooner we can order the necessary parts and schedule our engineer. With your financial donation we can get this project completed. Our team looks forward to providing you, our listeners, the programs and services you rely on well into the future. Thank you and don't forget to share this campaign with your friends!

Cast and Crew

Radio DJ - Tyson James

The Thoughtful Oracle - Genie Hambrick

Rys the Kitty  as Himself

Radio Reporter - Quinton Chandler

MJ -  Falcom Grear

Dance Troupe  #1 - Liam

Dance Troupe  #2 - Spencer Co

Old Fart - Michael Murray

Old Coot - Lars Schoder-Erie

Fisherman -  Haven Multz Matthews

Museum Curator - Ryjil Christensen  

GODZILLA   as Himself

Dave Anderson  as Himself

Kathleen Gustafson  as Herself

Lighting Technician -  Spencer Co

Director of Photography -  Kevin Co

Edited by  Fred Dickerson

Written and Directed By Rudy Multz

Special Thank You’s: The Cast and Crew! Dustin DJ Fiend, Travis Catron,  Pratt Museum, Billy Sullivan, Gulliver Norton, Anna Meredith and Jake Beaudoin, Ruth Dickerson, and the listeners and supporters of KBBI-- that means YOU!

The Plan:
We
have consulted a trusted engineer with years of experience working in public
radio stations throughout Alaska. We've researched two audio consoles that we must purchase, with your help, and install this summer.Getting this show on the Road…with perks!
We have some unique perks to offer. Like co-pilot a DJ show (Ryjil Christianson pictured below with Glenn Caldwell during Slack Tide). Check them all out on the right side of
this page. Click on a perk to go to a payment page. If you wish to keep your support private, select "Hide my name on the campaign page." Want to support at a different level? No worries, just enter the amount on the top right above "contribute now."
Where Your Donation Will Go:
All funds raised will support this project 100%.

The purchase of two new Wheatstone audio consoles, one for the on-air studio and one for audio production.
Shipping costs to Homer.
Parts, adapters and modifications inside the studios to
     meet the needs of the new digital equipment.
Travel and hosting costs for an engineer to install
     the equipment and reroute our electrical matrix (about 10 days). 
Immense gratitude from KBBI’s staff, volunteers, your fellow listeners and supporters of this project.
Best of all you'll help keep KBBI alive and available in our
     community 24/7.

Together
We Can Make This Happen!
Our two analog consoles have served KBBI and listeners well over the last
thirteen years, but the time has come for us to upgrade. The
more people we can reach, the sooner we can order the necessary parts and
schedule our engineer. With your financial donation we can get this project
completed. Our team looks forward to providing you, our listeners, the programs
and services you rely on well into the future. Thank you and don't forget to
share this campaign with your friends!Cast and Crew
Radio DJ - Tyson
James
The Thoughtful Oracle - Genie
Hambrick
Rys the Kitty  as
Himself
Radio Reporter - Quinton
Chandler
MJ -  Falcom
Grear

Dance Troupe  #2 - Spencer Co

Murray

Schoder-Erie

Christensen   
GODZILLA   as
Himself

Himself

Herself

Co
Director of Photography -  Kevin
Co
Edited by  Fred
DickersonWritten and Directed By Rudy
Multz
Special Thank You’s: The Cast and Crew! Dustin DJ Fiend, Travis Catron,  Pratt Museum, Billy Sullivan, Gulliver
Norton, Anna Meredith and Jake Beaudoin, Ruth Dickerson, and the listeners and
supporters of KBBI-- that means YOU!

story:
Mike needs to get out of his room and see the world around him. 

The  chair picture above is not the chair that Mike wants, but he liked the picture. Mike has been trapped in his bedroom over the past year with a wheelchair that is broken. He needs the chair to get around but can't leave his room since the wheelchair that he has now is broken. With a new chair he will be able to leave his room, visit neighbors, and go to local stores to make his own purchases. He is feeling "stir crazy" since he has to be helped to leave the room and there are few people who will help him exit the room. 

Contributors will be helping MIke to purchase a new wheelchair, and that chair will help him leave his room every day, instead of only when he has a medical appointment. You will also know that you have supported a good man who should be out among his neighbors instead of confined to a room.


Mike needs a new electric wheelchair

Mike's chair would be used to:

  • MIke will need $10,000 to purchase a new chair, since Medi-Cal won't pay for a new chair at this time, he needs help to purchase one on his own. 
  • Mike would be able to visit local stores and get out of his one room apartment, which he has not been able to do more than three times over the past year. 
  • All funds will go toward the wheelchair. 

The Impact

  • When Mike gets a new chair, he will be able to move forward on projects that he has in mind, such as becoming an entrepreneur, buying and selling merchandise, or recycling used items that would otherwise increase our landfills.
  • Most people can leave their house when they want and go where they want. Mike does not have the use of his legs, and so he needs a functioning wheelchair to get around his apartment and neighborhood. 

Risks & Challenges

Mike knows that he may be challenged to secure the funds needed to purchase a new chair, but he also knows that with enough support from friends, and acquaintances, as will as willing donors, he can achieve his goals. Mike is trying to work with various options to be able to either get repairs for his current electric chair or to secure a new electric chair. He is being told that if his chair is repaired it may last for a year. With a new chair He would be good to go for over five years. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Should you not be able to contribute, please tell other people about Mike and his need for an electric wheelchair. any amount will help and be greatly appreciated.

story:
The Get Outside Ball

What Is the Get Outside Ball?

The Get Outside Ball is a symbol of freedom and good health--a ticket to happiness, even--in the shape of a sphere that fits in the palm of your hand. It's gentle on the Earth, as it's made from recycled materials. Its purpose is to encourage its owner to get outside and have some fun--away from EMFs and fluorescent lighting and status updates and incessant ringtones. There's more to open space than cyberspace, and there's more to clouds than cloud computing! Log off and start living!     


Why Do We Need It?

Are you tired, lonely, pale as a vampire? Do you need to shield your eyes when you step out in the sunshine? Perhaps you have a family member whose behavior is sliding down the slippery slope of too much time inside: up all night at the computer, eating only from take-out containers, showering once in a blue moon (if that). Do you see more of your BFF online than in person? Are you "friends" with someone you haven't actually met in person? The Get Outside Ball can help you step away from the computer and out into the world. 

There are other uses for the ball, too:

Top Ten Alternative Uses for the Get Outside Ball*

1.  Roll the Get Outside Ball under each hand to stretch your fingers after too much time at the keyboard.

2.  Carve out part of the ball to hide an engagement ring inside for a memorable proposal.

3.  If successful with #2, use a Get Outside Ball as a wedding cake topper.

4.  Use a Get Outside Ball to prop up a book while you're reading outside on a beautiful day.

5.  Replace the fuzzy dice in your car with Get Outside Balls.

6.  Discreetly massage the arches of your feet while you're sitting on a park bench.

7.  Draw a face on it and call it "Wilson."

8.  Re-invent the wheel.

9.  Make a pair of earrings for your costume jewelry collection.

10. Give your Pet Rock a companion.

* These are suggestions only and are not meant to replace the professional advice of medical, therapeutic, legal or fashion experts.


Q&A

Q.  What is the Get Outside Ball?

A.  The Get Outside Ball (or GO Ball, if you prefer) is a revolutionary social networking tool that is easy to use, environmentally friendly and open-source, so you can share it freely with no licenses or royalties. In short, it's a ball. The great news: it's compact, portable, reasonably priced and made of recycled materials.

It's a ball that feels a bit squishy and fits in the palm of your hand. Below is a photo of our first prototype.



Q.  Is there an app for that?

A.  The Get Outside Ball is what's known as a first-generation AFD (App-Free Device).


Q.  Does it come with a charger?

A.  It comes charged for life.


Q.  Is there a camera inside?

A.  No, but there is nothing stopping you from adding your own.


Q.  Exactly how many inquiries has the Get Outside Ball team received from the NSA?

A.  That's classified. 


Q.  What are the messages on the Get Outside Ball and what's that odd-looking font?

A.  Each run of the Get Outside Ball comes with a unique set of upbeat messages to share the love of getting outside. And that's not a font, it's called "cursive." 


Q.  What's a "run"?

A.  A run is like a version (e.g., "version 2.0") without using the over-used term "version."


Q.  In what colors will the Get Outside Ball be available?

A.  Each run will feature a different combination of colors; we like colors that remind us of the outdoors: sky blue, sunflower yellow, grass green...


Q.  Will you be featuring "Social Butterfly Blue"?

A.  No.


Q. Where can I use my Get Outside Ball?

A.  Your Get Outside Ball is compact and its super-lightweight configuration lets you carry it anywhere--to the beach, parties, sports events, political rallies, concerts, MacWorld conventions... anywhere it's OK to have balls.


Q.  Is there anything to download?

A.  There's nothing to download, no drivers to update, no security releases, no registration, no passwords to remember, no hardware or software conflicts, no dongles and no AC adapters. Just get outside and enjoy the sunshine!


Q.  Does the Get Outside Ball give back?

A.  Yes. A portion of our proceeds will be donated to nonprofit organizations that help children in foster care. As much fun as it is to get outside, at the end of the day everyone needs a place to call home. 


The Impact


Your contribution will help our team move from prototype to archetype... no wait, that's not it. We'll move from prototype to purchasing our first run of 1,000 Get Outside Balls. We've sourced them from Europe, so you can expect them to have excellent manners and be snappy little dressers, too. Did we mention they are made from recycled content? Save the oceans! Take care of the turtles, too.

The Get Outside Ball is meant to encourage people to log off and live. Imagine doors opening across the land and people pouring out into the sunshine... frantically searching for a power switch on the Get Outside Ball until they realize, "This is what freedom feels like."

It's a good feeling and we hope you will be a part of it. 



Our Gratitude

Thank you for reading this far! We really appreciate it. 

  • Please take a minute, step outside, and breathe in some fresh air. Ahhh...
  • Feeling energized? If you have the time, would you let a friend know about the Get Outside Ball? The pun possibilities (that's how you roll, time to bounce, that one gets around...) are endless, but we'll leave it at: log off and live, log off and love. 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hello everybody, Thank you for taking the time to visit my page and learn about my cause.

Every year around Christmas time, I select a charity to donate money too, one that has some sort of personal connection to me and that I know will use the money I donate to directly benefit the people they represent. The organization I chose this year represents something very important to me, which is why I am seeking out friends, family, and strangers alike to help me make a large impact.

Within the past year, two of my close friends lost mothers to this horrible disease, and an uncle of mine was recently diagnosed with stage 4 non-smokers lung cancer.

This year in memory and honor of them, the Non-for profit I am donating to, is the Lung Cancer Alliance. By donating you will:

 . Help provide counseling and guidance for individuals and the families of individuals diagnosed with lung cancer

. Help fund research to develop better treatments and cures.

. Spread awareness and help eliminate stigma of lung cancer in the community

Lung cancer is the most deadly cancer in the United States, killing more people than breast, colon, and prostate cancer combine; it is also the least funded. Unfortunately Lung cancer is stigmatized as a “smokers disease”, therefore viewed by many as less deserving of their money. The harsh reality is that 15-20% diagnosed are non-smokers, another 50% are people who quit smoking before diagnosis. Regardless of the cause, People affected are still loved and valued by others and deserve the same amount of compassion. 

The goal is 1,000 dollars by 12/20/13.

I understand many of the people reading this may be a college student, recent graduate, or simply not in the best financial situation, but Even the smallest donation will help. If you cannot donate, sharing this page with somebody who has the means to do so would be greatly appreciated. If you have any more questions about my efforts or about lung cancer in general,

Please visit: http://www.lungcanceralliance.org

Thank you all for your time and support.

story:
My dear thyroid and I need a little help raising funds for a thryoid surgery. I have been battling Thyroid Disease since I was 12 when I had a nodule removed. I had a goiter for about 30 years, and then RAI (radio active iodine) treatment for Apathetic Hyperthyroidism which killed off most of my thyroid. Now my dear thyroid has grown a 3cm growth. The FNA biopsy found some suspicious cells which cannot be determined to be cancerous or beign unless it is surgically removed and then biopsied. They are only taking half of my diseased thyroid now, but if the tests come back positive for cancer, I will need to have a another surgery, total thyroidectomy and follow up.

I go to a wonderful clinic here in the Memphis area. Because of the many health challenges this past year, I am currently unemployed but the clinic offers discount rates on medical services. Which means I still have to pay my share of the office visit and surgeon fee. The hospital, anesthesiologist, and other costs associated with the surgery would not be discounted. I am already struggling to pay off over $5,000 in hospital bills and there is no way I can come up with the money needed for this surgery in the near future. 

The sad thing I have learned this past year is that there are so many who are without any health insurance and struggle to afford and obtain quality health care. I was recently diagnosed with diabetes which makes me pretty much unable to obtain health insurance even if I were employed and could afford it. I am thankful there are places and caring people that help the uninsured and underinsured.

So, thank you for taking time to read my request for help funding my thyroid surgery. Any help would be much appreciated. As a way of "PAYING IT FORWARD", I have commited to volunteering at Manna House Memphis. See my perks.

Manna House is a place of welcome for homeless persons and others in need.  At Manna House we welcome each guest with respect and compassion. Many of those who come to Manna House live nearby, either in modest homes or on the streets.  Others come to the neighborhood to eat a meal at the St. Vincent de Paul soup kitchen (called “the radio station”), located just a few blocks away.  Manna House is a place to sit and visit before or after a meal there.  It is a living room for people from the streets. For more information you can visit there facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Manna-House-Memphis/163896027029960
